entries.content: Session start - Working on CSS architecture for stream formatters. Goal: Create base CSS + provider-specific CSS for streaming markdown formatters (Codex, Claude, etc.). Need to understand existing CSS structure first.

Plan ready for stream-formatter CSS architecture. Will follow existing ultra-modular orchestrator pattern with base CSS + provider-specific overrides (Claude, Codex, Gemini). Structure mirrors provider-cooking and ui-indicator patterns.

Successfully created complete stream-formatter CSS architecture! 
- 13 files total (1 orchestrator, 9 module files, 3 provider files)
- Follows ultra-modular orchestrator pattern from existing codebase
- Includes [data-incomplete] support for StatefulInlineParser integration
- Provider-specific CSS for Claude (orange), Codex (green), Gemini (blue)
- Ready for integration with existing streaming system
Moti wants each Claude header (h1-h6) to have its own distinct color from the Claude orange palette, not gradients. Starting with Claude provider customization.

Updated Claude headers to use distinct colors from strongest to lightest:
h1: --claude-bright-orange (#FF6B35) - Strongest
h2: --claude-bright-peach (#FF8C42)
h3: --claude-copper (#D97757)
h4: --claude-primary (#CC785C)
h5: --claude-coral (#E8956D)
h6: --claude-peach (#F5A67F) - Lightest

Each header also gets gradually lighter font-weight (700 down to 600)

CSS not applying - selectors targeting .agent-message[data-provider="claude"] but HTML shows different structure. Need to find the actual provider attribute or chat container selector in the real DOM.

CSS is created but not being loaded because stream-formatter.css is not registered in the ResourceManager system. Need to add to 4 files: ResourceTypes.ts (2 interfaces), ResourceManager.ts (path config), TemplateInjector.ts (token map), and base.html (link tag). File edit conflicts - user may have file open.

Moti wants me to PLAN before executing. He's being cautious - "think 1000 times before doing something". Need to create a comprehensive plan for integrating the stream-formatter CSS into the resource loading system. Currently in PLAN MODE - NO EDITS allowed until plan is approved.

BRILLIANT INSIGHT from Moti! Instead of registering stream-formatter.css (which has @imports), create ONE consolidated CSS file with all the content inline. This way we only need to register 1 file instead of dealing with @import dependencies. Much simpler integration - only 5 files to edit, 6 lines total.

AH! Moti clarified - he wants me to use @import like ui-messages-list.css does (with url() syntax), NOT inline all the content. The @imports work fine in the webview - I was overthinking it. Just register the single orchestrator file with @imports.

Starting integration! Moti approved the plan. Registering stream-formatter.css orchestrator (with @imports) into the resource loading system. 5 files to edit, 6 lines to add. Going step by step carefully.
